text:
Would it be possible to split the basic CheckCaseOnly function of mod_speling, which has a lower server load and no security issues, from the full directory search functionality?

My shared hosting company seems to think the full mod_speling is too resource-intensive -- and they claim they can't activate just CheckCaseOnly without also allowing CheckSpelling.

CheckCaseOnly is really vital usability in a world where the vast majority of Web users are used to case-insensitive operating systems. 

It seems like it ought to be even a default Apache feature -- certainly not part of a more complex and potentially problematic extension.
creator: checkccaseonly@gmail.com
slive@apache.org
text:
That's exactly the point of the CheckCaseOnly directive. It lets you use only the case-correction part of mod_speling. You do indeed need to have CheckSpelling On, but the CheckCaseOnly directive limits its application to only that one feature.

(And by the way, the claim that doing only case checking is less resource-intensive than the full mod_speling treatment is really not correct.)
